content.description:
There are 2 cruxes: the first being a powerful move to surmount the first bulge and the second being a beautifully technical sequence (if you can read it) through the second bulge with a small tufa (which can be wet early in the season).

The route ends below the horizontal roof. There's a lone bolt in the middle of the roof that indicates an unfinished extension.

Do be careful straying too far left or right as there may still be some choss if you get off route.

In June 2019, there was a small nest with eggs in it just left of the route in the first bulge, so try not to murder the bird progeny.
content.protection: 7 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor equipped with perma-draws to lower.
content.location: This is the farthest left route at the Sanctuary. There is a small belay platform supported with a grid of logs below.

climbs.name: Primordium
climbs.fa: Equipped Jeremy Hensel, FA Sam Elias?

content.description:
Despite sharing a start with

Conception

, this steep line sat unfinished for over a year.

Climb the first three bolts of

Conception

, then step right, make a hard/scary clip, and go straight into the first crux.  Horrible slopers and awkward blocky holds lead to a good rest in a scoop below the second crux.  Pull another bulge and fight through shouldery moves in a shallow corner to another rest over a small roof.  Get it back and eke past some hard finger locks to better holds.

This route is totally safe but would be more pleasant if a few bolts were moved and one was added at the first crux.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor without chains.
content.location:
This is between

Conception

and

Genesis

.

climbs.name: Genesis
climbs.fa: Jeremy Hensel, Josh Gilger, Cory Case

content.description: Climb the steep wall out jugs to a crux pulling over the lip.  Then move up to a great rest below the upper face.  Traverse underneath the face to a second crux pulling yourself up onto the face.  Then climb the cool exposed face to the anchors.
content.location: This is the first route to the left of the corner.

content.description:
This is alternate ending to

The Enlightened Path

that traverses right before the cux.
content.location:
Climb

The Enlightened Path

over the first roof, then traverse up and right to the anchor.

climbs.name: The Enlightened Path
climbs.fa: Jeremy Hensel, Josh Gilger, and Cory Case

content.description: Climb the vertical/slab through fun, pocketed limestone.  It is different than most routes in Rifle.  The route has a few great rests and a couple of cruxes.
content.location: This is the long slab just right of the corner.

content.description: This route is on the left side of the steep wall.  Fun climbing through 2 boulder problems separated by a good rest.
